comments.raw_text: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.2; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: It should be possible to disable GIF animations with CSS. For example, to leave the GIF paused on the first frame of animation. This would allow user styles to selectively disable annoying animations with extensions like Stylish; ABP could be configured to prevent ads from animating without blocking them entirely; websites could pause animations on backgrounded page elements while displaying modal overlays; and disruptive animations in the tab strip could be disabled via userChrome.css. These should be possible without having to disable animations globally with image.animation_mode, which is far too broad. Reproducible: Always

comments.text: I think the 651506 dependency is incorrect.  That bug is talking about CSS animations, and making them stop like GIFs when escape (browser stop) is pressed.  This is about stopping GIF animations with CSS.
